translation: Sutra on the Three Heads of the Dhāraṇī

source_sentence: 唐三藏地婆訶羅奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by the Tang Tripiṭaka Dīpahara under imperial command
one great wheel dhāraṇī of the vajra

source_sentence: 訥謨薩怛唎耶　地毘迦喃　怛他揭多喃　唵毘囉　時毘囉時　摩訶斫迦囉　跋闍唎薩多薩多娑囉帝娑囉帝　怛唎曳怛唎曳毘陀末儞　三槃若儞　怛囉末底悉陀阿揭唎怛炎　娑婆訶誦此陀羅尼三七遍即當入一切漫荼羅(壇也)所作皆成(誦呪。
translation: "After reciting this dhāraṇī three or seven times, he'll enter all the maṇḍalas (altars, too) and all his works will be accomplished.
Making a seal and reciting the dhāraṇī is an easy way to accomplish it.
If he hasn't yet entered the altar, then he mustn't do it at once.
He can't do it without permission.

source_sentence: 即當入壇作印行不成盜法也)。
translation: He will then go to the altar, make the sign and recite the spell without stealing the Dharma.")

source_sentence: 南謨勃陀瞿(上聲)那(上聲)迷　南摩達摩　莫訶南謨僧伽多也泥底(丁以切)哩部卑薩(僧沒切)咄(登沒反)擔(平聲)納摩(誦此呪滅一切障亦能辟魔及除天災。
translation: Nanmo buddha ghū (upper voice), Nanmadharma (upper voice), and Mohe nanmo saṃghātā, nirde (dint'eche), libe sa (saṃbhuche), du (dengbuo), and tantra (plain voice).
Also, if you recite the mantra once, you should pay homage to the Buddha once.

source_sentence: 如此日別三時誦呪禮佛。
translation: Reciting the mantra at three separate times each day will cause him to worship the Buddha.

source_sentence: 未來當得二相端正具足果報)。
translation: In the future, he'll attain the rewards of having two characteristics that are correct and complete.")

source_sentence: 唵(上)摩利支曳　薩婆薩多婆頞陀利沙利娑(上聲)婆(去聲)訶誦此呪極護人身。
translation: Om (supra)mārīcīyī sarvāthabhūta-rṣādhārīsa (supra)bhūta (deprecatory) ha recites this dhāraṇī to guard his person extremely well.

source_sentence: 當日別三時各誦一百八遍。
translation: He recites it one hundred and eight times each at three different times of the day.
Sutra on the Three Heads of the Dhāraṇī
